intro: Bupleurum apiculatum f. subavenium, commonly known as the subavenous bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and the plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. It is valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
